summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 between personnel at the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General regarding the Epstein case. The key message is that, based on current knowledge, the public corruption supervisors do not intend to move forward with criminal charges against certain individuals mentioned on a call, and the recipient is instructed to proceed with interviews.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: Special Agent at the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General
persons.context: The Special Agent is the sender of the initial email on September 16, 2021, requesting a call regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the Special Agent wishes to include on a call regarding the Epstein case.

connections.description: The Special Agent requests to speak with M alongside SSA, indicating they are colleagues working on the Epstein case.

events.title: Decision Not to Pursue Charges
events.description: Public corruption supervisors decide, based on current knowledge, not to move forward with criminal charges against individuals mentioned on a prior call related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Request for Call Regarding Epstein Case
events.description: A Special Agent from the DOJ OIG requests a call with M and SSA to discuss the Epstein case.

locations: New York Field Office, U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General
keyFacts: In September 2021, the DOJ OIG was actively discussing the Epstein case via email.
Public corruption supervisors decided not to pursue criminal charges against certain individuals mentioned in connection with the case, based on the information known at that time.
The correspondence instructs the recipient to proceed with planned interviews despite the decision not to charge.
